meanings.definition: A small group of trained people who form the core of a larger organization or movement.
meanings.sent1: The cadre of teachers worked together to improve the school.
meanings.sent2: The cadre of firefighters quickly responded to the emergency.
meanings.sent3: The cadre of chefs decided to have a cook-off for fun.
meanings.sent4: The cadre of doctors was like a well-oiled machine in the operating room.
meanings.sent5: The cadre of artists painted a beautiful mural on the wall.

meanings.definition: The group of officers responsible for training and leading a military unit.
meanings.sent1: The cadre planned the training exercises for the new recruits.
meanings.sent2: The cadre led the soldiers into battle with precision.
meanings.sent3: The cadre organized a surprise party for the general.
meanings.sent4: The cadre was the backbone of the army, guiding them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The cadre's strategies were crucial in winning the war.

meanings.definition: A group of influential people within a political party or organization.
meanings.sent1: The cadre of politicians made important decisions for the country.
meanings.sent2: The cadre of activists protested for social change.
meanings.sent3: The cadre of comedians kept the audience entertained all night.
meanings.sent4: The cadre of advisors shaped the leader's policies.
meanings.sent5: The cadre of volunteers worked tirelessly for the cause.
